Dissolve Coe objects

the opposite of combine, typically used after it. Note that the $fac slot may be wrong since combine...well combines... this $fac. See examples.

dissolve(x, retain)

Arguments

x

a Coe object
retain

the partition id to retain. Or their name if the partitions are named (see x$method) eg after a chop

See also

Other handling functions: arrange, at_least, chop, combine, fac_dispatcher, filter, mutate, rescale, rm_harm, rm_uncomplete, rw_fac, sample_frac, sample_n, select, slice

Examples

data(bot)
w <- filter(bot, type=="whisky")
b <- filter(bot, type=="beer")
wf <- efourier(w, 10)
#> you selected `norm=TRUE`, which is not recommended. See ?efourier
bf <- efourier(b, 10)
#> you selected `norm=TRUE`, which is not recommended. See ?efourier
wbf <- combine(wf, bf)
dissolve(wbf, 1)
#> An OutCoe object [ elliptical Fourier analysis ]
#> --------------------
#>  - $coe: 20 outlines described, 10 harmonics
#> # A tibble: 20 x 2
#>   type   fake 
#>   <fct>  <fct>
#> 1 whisky a    
#> 2 whisky a    
#> 3 whisky a    
#> 4 whisky a    
#> 5 whisky a    
#> 6 whisky a    
#> # ... with 14 more rows
dissolve(wbf, 2)
#> An OutCoe object [ elliptical Fourier analysis ]
#> --------------------
#>  - $coe: 20 outlines described, 10 harmonics
#> # A tibble: 20 x 2
#>   type   fake 
#>   <fct>  <fct>
#> 1 whisky a    
#> 2 whisky a    
#> 3 whisky a    
#> 4 whisky a    
#> 5 whisky a    
#> 6 whisky a    
#> # ... with 14 more rows

# or using chop (yet combine here makes no sense)
bw <- bot %>% chop(~type) %>% lapply(efourier, 10) %>% combine
#> you selected `norm=TRUE`, which is not recommended. See ?efourier
#> you selected `norm=TRUE`, which is not recommended. See ?efourier
bw %>% dissolve(1)
#> An OutCoe object [ elliptical Fourier analysis ]
#> --------------------
#>  - $coe: 20 outlines described, 10 harmonics
#> # A tibble: 20 x 2
#>   type  fake 
#>   <fct> <fct>
#> 1 beer  c    
#> 2 beer  c    
#> 3 beer  c    
#> 4 beer  c    
#> 5 beer  c    
#> 6 beer  c    
#> # ... with 14 more rows
bw %>% dissolve(2)
#> An OutCoe object [ elliptical Fourier analysis ]
#> --------------------
#>  - $coe: 20 outlines described, 10 harmonics
#> # A tibble: 20 x 2
#>   type  fake 
#>   <fct> <fct>
#> 1 beer  c    
#> 2 beer  c    
#> 3 beer  c    
#> 4 beer  c    
#> 5 beer  c    
#> 6 beer  c    
#> # ... with 14 more rows
